Name: Blue Cash Preferred®
Rewards_rate:
6% Cash Back at U.S. supermarkets on up to $6,000 per year in purchases (then 1%).
6% Cash Back on select U.S. streaming subscriptions.
3% Cash Back on transit including taxis/rideshare, parking, tolls, trains, buses and more.
3% Cash Back at U.S. gas stations
1% Cash Back on other purchases
Pros:
Rewards can be redeemed for previous purchases.
There’s no enrollment required and no rotating categories to keep track
Cons:
The 6% bonus at U.S. supermarkets is excellent, but it’s capped to $6,000 in annual purchases, then 1%.
In addition, the 3% and 6% rewards are only applicable to U.S. purchases.
Review: Earn a whopping 6% cash back at U.S. supermarkets (up to $6,000 in purchases per year, then 1%) as well as on select U.S. streaming subscriptions, plus earn 3% cash back at U.S. gas stations and public transit. General purchases earn 1% cash back. As if that weren’t enough, you earn a $250 statement credit after you spend $3,000 in purchases within the first six months.

Name: American Express® Business Gold Card
Rewards_rate:
Earn 4X Membership Rewards® points on the 2 categories where your business spends the most each billing cycle from 6 eligible categories. While your top 2 categories may change, you will earn 4X points on the first $150,000 in combined purchases from these categories each calendar year (then 1X thereafter). Only the top 2 categories each billing cycle will count towards the $150,000 cap.
Earn 3X Membership Rewards® points on flights and prepaid hotels booked on amextravel.com using your Business Gold Card.
1X is earned for other purchases. **
Pros:
There are no blackout dates.
Points can be transferred to 16 partner airlines.
Cons:
If you’re hoping to redeem for anything beyond travel, you may be underwhelmed by redemption options.
The annual fee is much higher than cards with similar offers.
Review: As an introductory bonus, small business owners earn 70,000 points after spending $10,000 on eligible purchases within the first three months of card membership. Plus, earn 4X points on your top two spending categories where your business spends the most each billing cycle (out of six eligible categories), up to $150,000 in purchases annually, then 1X.

Name: The Business Platinum Card®
Rewards_rate:
5X Membership Rewards® points on flights and prepaid hotels on AmexTravel.com
Earn 1.5X on each eligible purchase at US construction material, hardware suppliers, electronic goods retailers, and software & cloud system providers, and shipping providers, as well as on purchases of $5,000 or more everywhere else, on up to $2 million of these purchases per calendar year.
1X points for each dollar you spend on eligible purchases.
Pros:
Cardmembers have access to over 1,400 airport lounges around the world.
There are no blackout dates and points don’t expire as long as the account remains in good standing.
Cons:
Travel must be redeemed through the American Express Travel portal.
There is a fee to transfer points to airline loyalty programs.
Review:
Big business spenders can earn 120,000 points after spending $15,000 on eligible purchases within the first three months of account opening. Plus, cardmembers can receive a 35% airline bonus on points redeemed through amextravel.com on your select qualifying airline (up to 1,000,000 points per calendar year).
With a whopper of an introductory bonus and excellent travel benefits, the Business Platinum Card from American Express is a solid card for high-spending business owners on the go.

Name: Delta SkyMiles® Gold Business American Express Card
Rewards_rate:
Earn 2 miles per dollar spent on purchases at U.S. Shipping providers and at U.S. providers for Advertising in select media on up to $50,000 of purchases per category, per year.
Earn 2 Miles on every dollar spent on eligible purchases made directly with Delta and on every eligible dollar spent at restaurants.
Earn 1 Mile on every eligible dollar spent on purchases.
Pros:
Miles may be redeemed for one-way flights.
Miles never expire and there are no blackout dates.
Cons:
The fuel surcharge on international rewards flights can be very high in some cases.
Rewards flights booked via the telephone incur a $25 booking fee, or $35 for flights booked in a ticket office.
Review: Delta die-hards can earn 2X miles on direct Delta purchases and at restaurants, 2X miles on U.S. purchases for advertising select media and U.S. shipping purchases (on up to $50,000 in eligible purchases per category, per year), plus 1X miles on all eligible purchases. You can earn 80,000 bonus miles after you spend $6,000 in purchases in your first six months of card membership (limited time offer ends 3/27/24). Members can also earn a credit worth up to $200 on future Delta flights after spending $10,000 in a calendar year. In addition, the $150 annual fee has an introductory $0 annual fee for the first year.

Name: Hilton Honors American Express Surpass® Card
Rewards_rate:
Earn 12X Hilton Honors Bonus Points for each dollar of eligible purchases charged on your Card directly with a hotel or resort within the Hilton portfolio.
Earn 6X Points for each dollar of purchases on your Card at U.S. restaurants, at U.S. supermarkets, and at U.S. gas stations.
Earn 4X Points for each dollar on U.S. Online Retail Purchases.
Earn 3X Points for all other eligible purchases on your Card.
Pros:
Points never expire as long as the card remains active.
Points can be used to upgrade reservations.
Cons:
Beyond hotel stays, redemption options are limited.
Reward rates for regular rooms are sometimes inflated to premium rates.
Review:
With this card, Hilton loyalists earn 12X points at participating Hilton hotels and resorts, as well as 6X points at U.S. restaurants, supermarkets, and gas stations. All other eligible purchases earn 3X points. Cardmembers also receive automatic Gold Status plus complimentary National Car Rental® Emerald Club Executive® status.
You’ll earn 130,000 points after spending $3,000 on eligible purchases within the first six months of opening the account.
